Question.QuestionStem: Which one of the following is a primary goal of the Health Risk Assessment (HRA) process?

Options.Option: Develop strategies for disease surveillance programs.
Determine and select appropriate administrative controls.
Include professional judgment which is based on estimates.
Minimize health threats and negative health outcomes.

Question.QuestionStem: Which one of the following processes is the portion of Health Risk Assessment (HRA) that focuses on the quantification of health risks?

Options.Option: Occupational and Environmental Health Site Assessment (OEHSA)

Question.QuestionStem: During which one of the following Occupational and Environmental Health Site Assessment (OEHSA) steps in the site selection process should you collect and document known information about contamination and pollution in air, water, and soil?

Which two of the following are BE roles in the site selection process?
  1. Conducting water vulnerability assessments.
  2. Maintaining security surrounding the site.
  3. Developing occupational health programs.
  4. Recommending the location of facilities.
Which step in the Occupational and Environmental Health Site Assessment (OEHSA) process will be used for verification?
Which site consideration do stressed plants and soil discoloration fall into?

During which part of Occupational and Environmental Health Site Assessment (OEHSA) will you conduct sampling to gain more information about the sites being considered for the water treatment facility?

In what two ways does the assessment type affect sampling strategy development?
  1. Health threats identified
  2. Prioritizing the assessment needs
  3. It is not necessary to define the scope of support and resources
  4. Compliance assessments are conducted only for deployed settings

Which two of the following are potential exposure assessment goals for the sampling strategy at each of the four sites?
  1. Analyze risks to water treatment workers.
  2. Communicate health risks present.
  3. Identify the degree of health threat.
  4. Fulfill a special purpose.
Which type of radiation is primarily used for communications and can also be used for weather surveillance, search and detection radar, and remote control devices?
Which one of the following is a reason why radio frequency radiation (RFR) risk assessments are performed?

Options.Option: To determine the strategic value of the emitter.
To establish a safe perimeter around the emitter.
To set baseline levels of ionizing radiation in the area.
To evaluate a technician’s performance with the emitter.

Question.QuestionStem: Which one of the following is NOT a characteristic of radio frequency radiation (RFR)?
An early warning system at Site A is an example of which one of the following types of radio frequency radiation (RFR) emitters found in the Air Force?
Which one of the following is NOT a component of a radio frequency radiation (RFR) emitter?
Which one of the following describes the frequencies where optimal absorption takes place?

Which two of the following should you complete during the analysis phase of your radio frequency radiation (RFR) risk assessment at Site A?
  1. Identify the applicable Permissible Exposure Limits (PEL) for each emitter.
  2. Define the appropriate controls for the hazard.
  3. Communicate risk to the technicians operating emitter.
  4. Determine the risk assessment rating for the emitter.
Which one of the following is the first step you should complete when performing a radio frequency radiation (RFR) measurement survey at Site A?

Options.Option: Take small steps towards the emitter.
Begin surveying until the Permissible Exposure Limit (PEL) is found.
Obtain absolute control of the emitter.
Have the operator turn off the emitter.

Question.QuestionStem: Which one of the following methods will you use to determine whether the site is a hazardous noise area, by taking into account the actual sound intensity and exposure durations present in the area?
Which one of the following would be required in order for Site A to be considered a hazardous noise area?

Options.Option: 8-hour continuous sound level greater than 85 dB(A)
4-hour continuous sound level greater than 30 dB(A)
Continuous or intermittent noise greater than 70 dB
Peak sound pressure level less than 140 dB

Question.QuestionStem: How long can personnel safely remain in an area while being exposed to a hazardous noise source with a measured sound level of 88 dB(A)?

Which two of the following will be best to use, for screening purposes, to evaluate the background concentrations of aircraft exhaust from use of JP-8?
  1. Integrated sampling
  2. Instantaneous sampling
  3. Area sampling
  4. Personal sampling
Which of the following defines the Occupational and Environmental Exposure Limit - Time Weighted Average (OEEL-TWA)?

Options.Option: A calculation used to adjust exposure standards when the employee is working more than 8 hours a day and 40 hours a week.
A concentration to which workers can be exposed continuously for a short period of time without suffering from adverse health effects.
The concentration of airborne contaminants to which workers are exposed that must never be exceeded during any part of the workday.
The concentration to which nearly all workers may be exposed, 8 hours per day, 40 hours per week, without adverse health effects.

Question.QuestionStem: Using the Brief and Scala Model, calculate the equivalent Occupational and Environmental Exposure Limit (OEEL) for JP-8 exposure by workers with a 9-hour workday. The OEEL8-hr for JP-8 is 29 ppm.
Which situation is the LEAST appropriate circumstance for collecting soil or solid samples?

Options.Option: An aircraft fuel tank overflows and spills JP-8 on the pavement.
An underground storage tank is removed and a crack is discovered.
You are conducting an Environmental Baseline Survey.
Lead-based paint is being removed from inside base housing.

Question.QuestionStem:
Which two of the following are factors that you should consider when developing a soil and solid sampling strategy?
  1. Type of standard
  2. Assessment type
  3. Threat characterization
  4. Sampling objectives
In which soil sampling approach are sampling locations selected based on historical information, visual inspection, and professional judgment?
Which of the following is the first step you will take when performing field analysis at Site B?

Options.Option: Screen for elements of highest risk.

Question.QuestionStem: Which of the following is the first step you will take when interpreting the results of the samples you collected at Site B for environmental analysis?

Which two of the following characteristics of the water samples should you try to ensure by choosing the most appropriate sampling point locations at Site C?
  1. Limpidity
  2. Heterogeneity
  3. Homogeneity
  4. Representativeness

Which two of the following statements describe why biological health threats should be identified and analyzed at Site D?
  1. To make control decisions or recommendations to the Commander.
  2. To protect the health of personnel on the base and in the community.
  3. To allow the BEE to make decisions about whether to establish a quarantine.
  4. To accurately predict the incidents of illness that could affect base personnel.
Which category of biological health threat causes diseases that are transmitted by humans and can often be successfully treated with antibiotics?
Hand washing is a method of stopping the spread of disease at what point in the chain of infection?
Which one of the following best describes the risk level for an exposure that seldom occurs and would have negligible effects on the mission?

Which two of the following statements best describe the relationship of results to standards, mission accomplishment, and health effects?
  1. The BE Tech uses the sampling results to make decisions about the mission and the anticipated effects.
  2. When comparing results to standards, the total exposure must be considered in context of the mission.
  3. Interpretation of the results is affected only by the workday exposures and the acceptable levels of risk.
  4. Intelligence, mission details, and other dynamics affect how the sampling results are interpreted.

When a water main breaks, what two disinfection procedures should typically be followed?
  1. After 24 hours, flush the lines until the water runs clear.
  2. Maintain a Cl2 concentration of 500 ppm for 30 minutes.
  3. Maintain a Cl2 concentration of 50 ppm for 24 hours.
  4. After 30 minutes, flush the lines until the water runs clear.

If a repair is needed at the water treatment facility, what is the FINAL step you must take after a water main break is repaired, before notifying the affected personnel or community the water is safe to drink?

Options.Option: Apply hypochlorite to all new components.
Flush the line until the water runs clear.

Question.QuestionStem:
Which two of the following are reasons for performing a base sanitary survey?
  1. To identify areas in a water system that could be subject to sabotage.
  2. To ensure treated water quality meets drinking water standards.
  3. To evaluate the installation’s ability to prevent contamination.
  4. To identify deficiencies in the system so they can be corrected.

Which two of the following are purposes of the final written report you will create during the post-survey phase of the sanitary survey?
  1. To provide a record for future inspectors.
  2. To notify system operators of deficiencies.
  3. To offer recommendations about vulnerability.
  4. To document critical limit monitoring procedures.

Because the installation’s water system has been modified, which of the following must you perform to identify areas in the water distribution system that could be subject to tampering, sabotage, and contamination?
In which step of the water vulnerability assessment (WVA) process will you identify subject matter experts (SMEs) and arrange a time to interview them?

On which two of the following fundamental ideas is health risk communication focused?
  1. Communicating technical data and providing risk estimations.
  2. Providing simple and practical health risk comparisons to your audience.
  3. Providing practical and effective information and recommendations.
  4. Communicating the right information to the right people, at the right time.

Which two of the following are techniques for effective health risk communication?
  1. Deal with uncertainty.
  2. Use risk comparisons freely.
  3. Communicate clearly and honestly.
  4. Communicate using scientific terms.
Which of the following should be evaluated during an aircraft watering point survey?
How many octave bands should you test when conducting an audiometric booth survey?
Which one of the following pieces of data is NOT required to be collected when performing an octave band survey?

Which two of the following are engineering controls used to control noise health threats at the source?
  1. Worker Rotation
  2. Room Treatments
  3. Product Substitution
  4. Machine Treatments
Which one of the following is NOT a calculation you will perform when considering options for controlling hazardous exposures to noise?
Which one of the following steps should you complete first when analyzing and classifying a confined space?

Options.Option: Analyze the space using indirect reading instruments.
Analyze the space for slippery and uneven walking surfaces.
Analyze the space using atmospheric monitoring equipment.
Analyze the space using observations and personal interviews.

Question.QuestionStem:
Which two of the following are characteristics of a permit-required confined space?
  1. Oxygen levels in the space are less than 19.5% or greater than 23.5%.
  2. All present hazards can be eliminated without having to enter the space.
  3. It contains no actual or potential hazards that could cause injury or death.
  4. The Lower Explosive Limit (LEL) is greater than 10%, making it flammable.
Which one of the following describes the relationship between energy and mass?
Which one of the following radiation categories found in the electromagnetic spectrum is primarily used for communications?
Which one of the following describes the spontaneous disintegration or transformation of an atom in an attempt to reach a stable state?
Which one of the following is energy lost by particles along the path through which they are traveling?
Which one of the following types of ionizing radiation can interact through bremsstrahlung?

Which two of the following types of radiation are primarily ingestion or inhalation health threats?
  1. Alpha
  2. Beta
  3. Gamma / X-Ray
  4. Neutrons
Which one of the following is NOT a step that should be performed as a part of an x-ray scatter survey?

Options.Option: Place a 1 gallon container of water in the beam.
Sketch the x-ray room and the adjacent areas.
Conduct a comprehensive inventory of all PPE available.
Monitor worker and adjacent areas for radiation leakage.

Question.QuestionStem:
Which two of the following are situations where a scatter survey must be conducted on an x-ray unit?
  1. When operation modifications have occurred.
  2. After 6 months of continual operation.
  3. Prior to the device being put into use.
  4. Prior to the first full month of operation.
Which one of the following survey calculations should be used to determine annual x-ray exposures?

Options.Option: Radioactive Decay for an Activity at an Earlier Date
Radioactive Decay for a Current Activity

Question.QuestionStem: Which one of the following describes that you should always try to keep radiation exposures as minimal as possible, regardless of the standard?

Because scatter survey results at a dental facility waiting room are calculated to be 101.2 mR/yr, which two of the following are potential courses of action you should take?
  1. Relocate or rearrange the waiting room.
  2. Post warning signs in the waiting room.
  3. Relocate the x-ray room within the facility.
  4. Suspend all x-ray operations at the facility.
Which one of the following is a method for determining and documenting the circumstances surrounding a suspected ionizing radiation overexposure?

Options.Option: Sampling for ultraviolet radiation sources in the shop.
Making control recommendations to the shop supervisor.
Performing an onsite review of the dosimeters collected.
Completing a detailed sketch of the positions of personnel.

Question.QuestionStem:
Which two of the following situations would prompt an ionizing radiation overexposure investigation?
  1. A survey meter is returned over the exposure limit.
  2. An individual’s TLD reads greater than 500 mR.
  3. An individuals EPD reads greater than 50 mR.
  4. A new piece of equipment is added to the shop.
Which one of the following types of controls should be the first method to control ionizing radiation exposures?
Which one of the following types of materials would serve as a minimally appropriate shield for alpha particles?

When using an ion chamber to determine the dose rate of exposures for radioactive materials (RAM) storage and use surveys, how far should the measurements be taken from external sources or surfaces the radiation penetrates?

Which two of the following describe the importance of performing radioactive materials (RAM) storage and use surveys?
  1. Identify "problem" isotopes that require special attention.
  2. Protect personnel and the environment from RAM exposures.
  3. Determine the most effective method for disposal and transport.
  4. Ensure compliance with the use, storage, and transfer of RAM.
Once you have completed a swipe on the package when performing a radioactive materials (RAM) shipment or transport survey, what should be your next course of action?

Options.Option: Record the results from the dose rate measurements.
Ensure proper labeling and markings on the package.
Open package and perform a dose rate measurement.
Take dose rate exposure measurement on all sides of package.

Question.QuestionStem:
During which two of the following situations should a radioactive materials (RAM) shipment be surveyed?
  1. Before packing the RAM.
  2. Before shipping the RAM.
  3. During the shipping process.
  4. After receiving the shipment.
Which one of the following is calculated first when a radioactive materials (RAM) shipment swipe has been taken?
Which of the following is the central point of contact for the disposal of radioactive materials for the Air Force?

Which two of the following are critical organs that are at risk for radio frequency radiation (RFR) exposures?
  1. Eyes
  2. Lungs
  3. Heart
  4. Gall Bladder
Which of the following is NOT calculated to determine the Estimated Hazard Distance (D<sub>pel</sub>)?

Once BE is notified of a potential radio frequency radiation (RFR) overexposure or accident, which two of the following should be notified?
  1. Public Health
  2. CE Readiness
  3. MAJCOM BEE
  4. AFMSA/SG3PB

Which two of the following are reasons why a radio frequency radiation (RFR) overexposure/accident investigation is performed?
  1. To identify operation deficiencies.
  2. To calculate the appropriate Permissible Exposure Limit (PEL).
  3. To determine severity of exposure.
  4. To determine strategic value of emitter.

Which one of the following types of radio frequency radiation (RFR) controls should be used in a situation where an RFR emitter needs to be switched off because a door, hatch, or other entry point is breached?
Which one of the following types of light do lasers produce?

Which two of the following factors influence how laser systems are classified?
  1. Frequency
  2. Wavelength
  3. Expected exposure distance for personnel
  4. Capability to cause health effects to personnel
Which one of the following describes the distance along the laser beam beyond which the exposure is not expected to exceed the maximum limit?
When analyzing laser hazards, what are you able to do after determining the Maximum Permissible Exposure (MPE), Nominal Ocular Hazard Distance (NOHD), and Nominal Hazard Zone (NHZ)?

Options.Option: Define the area of responsibility (AOR), area of operations (AO), and missions associated with the laser hazards.
Obtain parameters of the laser such as wavelength, optical power, beam divergence, and aperture beam diameter.
Determine the acute and chronic health effects that will likely be experienced by personnel who are exposed to laser hazards.
Identify the amount and type of energy a person can be exposed to before the exposure becomes hazardous at a certain distance.

Question.QuestionStem:
Which two of the following are factors contributing to the biological effects of laser exposures?
  1. Wavelength
  2. Exposure Duration
  3. Color of the Laser Beam
  4. Intended Use of the Laser

Which one of the following steps for identifying laser hazards should you perform in the Pre-deployment/Baseline Activities phase of the Occupational and Environmental Health Site Assessment (OEHSA) process?

Options.Option: Determine which personnel may be affected by the laser hazard.
Obtain any available information about existing lasers in the area of concern (AOC).
Use measuring equipment for lasers to conduct a survey of the area.
Perform a site visit to confirm the information that has been gathered.

Question.QuestionStem:
Which two of the following are appropriate control recommendations for using a Class 2 laser, such as an aiming device?
  1. Protecting housing
  2. Standard operating procedures
  3. Optional posting of "Caution" signs
  4. Required posting of "Danger" signs

Which two of the following are factors you should consider when recommending laser eye protection (LEP)?
  1. Wavelength
  2. Age of laser system
  3. Optical Density (OD)
  4. Length of exposure to laser
What type of exposure did a worker likely receive who was severely sunburned?

Which two of the following could be recommendations for controlling ultraviolet (UV) radiation when welding?
  1. Restrict access to the area around the UV/IR source.
  2. Lessen the amount of time exposed to the UV/IR source.
  3. Issue respirators and sunglasses to all workers around the area.
  4. Workers should wear light colored clothing around UV/IR sources.
During which step of the biological health threat identification and analysis process will you conduct interviews?
Which organization is responsible for disease surveillance and food safety surveillance?
Which one of the following is an engineering control you could recommend for biological health threats?

Options.Option: Issuing gloves, safety goggles, and masks.

Question.QuestionStem:
Which two of the following statements are true regarding the proper use of respiratory protection?
  1. Fit testing must be conducted prior to issuing any kind of respiratory protection.
  2. Respirators should be stored in a clean, dry location away from direct sunlight.
  3. Fit testing is required prior to issuing respiratory protection relying on a mask-to-face seal.
  4. For convenience, respirators should be stored near the chemicals for which they will be used.

Which two of the following are steps you should take while analyzing chemical health threats?
  1. Determine which chemicals should be used for a given process.
  2. Determine the Health Risk Estimate for each identified chemical.
  3. Determine why the health threat is an actual or potential problem.
  4. Determine the effectiveness of the mission when using the chemicals.

Which two of the following statements describe situations in which a respirator should be used?
  1. Permanent controls are awaiting funding, or they are being designed or installed.
  2. Employees request respiratory protection, such as a half mask, for personal comfort.
  3. Based on professional judgment, the supervisor expects exposures greater than the action level.
  4. Other means of control are not feasible or cannot decrease the contaminant to acceptable levels.

You were recently called to a shop to recommend an appropriate respirator for personnel who are working in a confined space with oxygen levels at 15.9%. Which two of the following statements are true regarding this situation?
  1. An escape-only respirator should be selected.
  2. You must choose RP according to AFOSH Std 91-25.
  3. A self-contained breathing apparatus should be used.
  4. An air-purifying full face piece respirator should be used.

Which two of the following methods would be most appropriate to control workers’ exposure to a highly toxic chemical?
  1. Local exhaust ventilation system
  2. Quarter-mask air-purifying respirator
  3. Full-face air-purifying respirator
  4. Dilution ventilation system

Which two of the following actions should a worker take when borrowing a co-workers respirator?
  1. Refuse to wear the borrowed respirator.
  2. Inspect the borrowed respirator for defects.
  3. Clean and disinfect the borrowed respirator before use.
  4. Request an immediate replacement respirator from BE.

Under which two of the following conditions must a regulated area be established?
  1. Whenever required by Title 29 Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) 1910 or 29 CFR 1926.
  2. In any occupational area where hazardous chemicals or other substances are used routinely.
  3. In areas that, in the supervisor’s professional judgment, are potentially dangerous for personnel.
  4. In areas where hazardous exposures exceed, or are expected to exceed, acceptable limits.
Which of the following statements best describes local exhaust ventilation?

Options.Option: This ventilation is best used in temperate climates and low humidity.
This ventilation involves pulling air into the room to mix with contaminated air.
This ventilation system is generally composed of large exhaust fans in the walls or roof.
This ventilation is designed to remove the contaminant prior to its escape into the workplace.

Question.QuestionStem: Which of the following is an example of an occupational setting where dilution ventilation is an effective measure of control?

Which one of the following statements must be true regarding the results of a static pressure test to arrive at the conclusion that the ventilation system is adequately controlling contaminants of concern (COCs)?

Options.Option: Results are within 10 percent of the baseline value.
Results are within 15 percent of the baseline value.
Results are within 10 percent of initial survey results.
Results are within 15 percent of initial survey results.

Question.QuestionStem:
Which two of the following are steps you should conduct in Phase 1 of the toxic industrial chemical/toxic industrial material (TIC/TIM) vulnerability assessment process, Planning and Coordination?
  1. Identify the team
  2. Collect TIC/TIM data
  3. Develop location maps
  4. Develop a list of stakeholders
According to AFI 41-106, how often must a toxic industrial chemical/toxic industrial material (TIC/TIM) vulnerability assessment be conducted?
Which one of the following statements describes a health threat?

Options.Option: The process of estimating the human toxicological impact of a specific material based on published and unpublished literature sources.
The process of effectively communicating potential health effects, outcomes, and control measures to all stakeholders.
A potential or actual condition that can cause short or long-term injury, illness, or death to personnel.
A measure of the likelihood of an adverse health effect to a given individual or population.

Question.QuestionStem:
Which two of the following statements are true regarding Occupational and Environmental Health Site Assessment (OEHSA)
  1. OEHSA is the overarching process that includes Health Risk Assessment (HRA) and focuses on the quantification of health risks.
  2. OEHSA is the key operational health tool to produce data and information used for HRA and to satisfy Occupational and Environmental Health (OEH) surveillance requirements.
  3. OEHSA is executed as soon as operationally feasible and is dependent on whether the location is in a permissible or non-permissible environment.
  4. OEHSA is a decision-making process used to evaluate and select courses of action (COAs), minimize OEH risks, and maximize benefits for operations and missions.
In which one of the following Occupational and Environmental Health Site Assessment (OEHSA) steps in the site selection process should you determine the potential areas of operation (AOs)?

Which two of the following are actions taken by BE during site selection?
  1. Selecting which shops should be located on a base.
  2. Finding sites that meet sanitation requirements.
  3. Minimizing environmental impacts.
  4. Designing the water main system.
During which one of the following steps in the Occupational and Environmental Health Site Assessment (OEHSA) process does the development of the Conceptual Site Model (CSM) begin?

Which two of the following are factors you should consider when determining the appropriateness of each potential site for the water treatment facility?
  1. Political consent
  2. Population density
  3. Soil composition
  4. Sources of pollution
Choose the statement that best describes how the development of a sampling strategy relates to the Health Risk Assessment (HRA) process.

Options.Option: Sampling is conducted during routine or special assessment.
Sampling is useful for identifying and analyzing health threats and risks.
Multiple sampling strategies may be necessary for multiple health threats.
Occupational and Environmental Health (OEH) sampling is critical to assist with facility placement decision-making.

Question.QuestionStem: Which one of the following is the first step in a special assessment?

Options.Option: Define the scope of support and resources needed.
Prioritize assessment needs to maximize resources.

Question.QuestionStem:
In this case, which two of the following sampling strategy objectives describe the primary reasons for conducting sampling at each of the four sites?
  1. Identifying the degree of health threat.
  2. Fulfilling a special purpose.
  3. Assessing compliance.
  4. Evaluating controls.
Which type of radiation is emitted by the search and detection radar at Site A?
When should a radio frequency radiation (RFR) risk assessment be performed?

Options.Option: Once an emitter is identified as being able to produce levels that meet or exceed the Permissible Exposure Limit (PEL).
Before an RFR emitter is placed within close proximity of strategic targets at the base location.
Any time a new technician is assigned to an emitter that is classified as high risk.
After an RFR measurement survey has been conducted that identified abnormal hotspots.

Question.QuestionStem: Which one of the following statements best describes radio frequency radiation’s (RFR’s) placement on the electromagnetic spectrum?

Options.Option: RFR occurs in the lower frequencies of the electromagnetic spectrum.
RFR occurs in the middle frequencies of the electromagnetic spectrum.
RFR occurs in the high frequencies of the electromagnetic spectrum.
RFR is not located on the electromagnetic spectrum.

Question.QuestionStem: Which one of the following types of radio frequency radiation (RFR) emitters is generally the most hazardous type of emitter?
Which one of the following components of a radio frequency radiation (RFR) emitter is capable of generating a continuous wave or pulsed wave?
Which one of the following frequency ranges identifies where optimal absorption of radio frequency radiation (RFR) takes place for adult humans?

Which two of the following pieces of information should you obtain about the radio frequency radiation (RFR) emitters present at Site A during the identification phase of your RFR risk assessment?
  1. Duty Factor
  2. Antenna Size
  3. Peak Power
  4. Applicable Permissible Exposure Limit (PEL)

After identifying the actual Dpel when conducting the radio frequency radiation (RFR) measurement survey at Site A, what should be your next two courses of action?
  1. Perform the estimated hazard distance calculation.
  2. Measure from the antenna to where the probe stopped.
  3. Move toward the emitter while taking spatial averages.
  4. Have the operator of the emitter turn off the system.

If you used the indirect method for determining whether the site is a hazardous noise area, which two of the following could be used as the indication that the area is hazardous?
  1. The C/T calculation is greater than 1.
  2. The LeqT calculation is over 95 dB(A).
  3. The LeqT calculation is over 85 dB(A).
  4. The C/T calculation is greater than 100.
In which one of the following situations would Site A be considered a hazardous noise area?

Options.Option: Peak sound pressure level less than 140 dB
Continuous or intermittent noise greater than 115 dB
4-hour continuous sound level greater than 30 dB(A)
8-hour continuous sound level less than 85 dB(A)

Question.QuestionStem: How long can personnel safely remain in the area while being exposed to 91 dB(A) noise levels?

Which two of the following would you use to get a quick initial estimate of personnel exposure to exhaust from aircraft using JP-8 fuel?
  1. Instantaneous sampling
  2. Integrated sampling
  3. Indirect reading devices
  4. Direct reading instruments
Which of the following defines the Occupational and Environmental Exposure Limit – Short-term Exposure Limit (OEEL-STEL)?

Options.Option: A calculation used to adjust exposure standards when the employee is working more than 8 hours a day and 40 hours a week.
A concentration to which workers can be exposed continuously for a short period of time without suffering from adverse health effects.
The concentration of airborne contaminants to which workers are exposed that must never be exceeded during any part of the workday.
The concentration to which nearly all workers may be exposed, 8 hours per day, 40 days per week, without adverse health effects.

Question.QuestionStem: Using the Brief and Scala Model, calculate the equivalent Occupational and Environmental Exposure Limit (OEEL) for JP-8 exposure for workers with an 8-hour work day, 6 days per week. The OEEL8-hr for JP-8 is 29 ppm.
Which of the following is NOT typically a reason for collecting soil or solid samples?

Options.Option: To identify health risks to personnel.
To define the area of concern (AOC).

Question.QuestionStem:
Which two of the following are most likely to be affected by the time available to conduct sampling?
  1. Type of analysis
  2. Number of samples
  3. Depth of sampling
  4. Health control decisions

Which soil sampling approach divides the site into different, internally homogenous sampling areas and is used for investigating a large site that encompasses a number of soil types, topographic features, or land uses?
During which step of field analysis will you consider the ways in which personnel could be exposed to any contaminants present at Site B?

Options.Option: Screen for elements of highest risk.

Question.QuestionStem: When interpreting the results of the samples you collected at Site B for environmental analysis, which step should you take after selecting a standard?

Options.Option: Convert the units of measurement if necessary.
Identify abnormal results, trends, and variations.
Compare results with historical data for the site.

Question.QuestionStem:
By choosing the most appropriate sampling point locations, which two of the following characteristics of the water samples should you try to ensure?
  1. Limpidity
  2. Homogeneity
  3. Heterogeneity
  4. Representativeness

Which two of the following describe situations in which biological health threats should be identified and analyzed?
  1. When a worker expresses concern about a chemical exposure or effects.
  2. During an initial, routine, or special occupational health risk assessment.
  3. When an illness or injury report occurs related to a potential biological health threat.
  4. When a new process is introduced in the workplace that involves excessive noise.
A biological agent such as the Giardia intestinalis parasite, which can be very contagious, is said to have high _____________.

Which two of the following are methods of breaking the chain of infection targeting the source of the infection?
  1. Disinfecting surfaces.
  2. Receiving vaccinations.
  3. Sneezing into one’s sleeve.
  4. Treating an illness with antibiotics.
Which one of the following best describes the risk level for an exposure that occurs frequently and would probably have catastrophic effects on the mission?

Which two of the following affect how sampling results are interpreted when making a determination on the best location for a water treatment facility?
  1. Mission details
  2. Contaminant
  3. Intelligence
  4. Equipment

Which two of the following are your responsibilities related to the new water mains associated with the new water treatment facility?
  1. Run bacteriological sampling analysis.
  2. Follow the base’s water contingency response plan.
  3. Conduct engineering reviews of scheduled repairs.
  4. Ensure the distribution system is isolated to control contaminants.

Which two of the following are your responsibilities related to water system repair if needed at the water treatment facility?
  1. Run bacteriological sampling analysis.
  2. Perform the repairs to the water system.
  3. Conduct engineering reviews of repairs.
  4. Notify all Commanders of the repair situation.

For which two of the following reasons are base sanitary surveys performed?
  1. To evaluate an installation’s ability to prevent contamination and disruptions.
  2. To identify vulnerabilities in the water distribution system of an installation.
  3. To identify deficiencies in the water system so they can be corrected.
  4. To comply with regulatory requirements to conduct sanitary surveys.

Which two of the following are purposes of the pre-survey file review you perform before scheduling sanitary survey activities?
  1. To notify system operators of deficiencies and recommend corrective actions.
  2. To ensure that the treated water quality meets all drinking water standards.
  3. To help create a list of items to check in the field and questions to ask.
  4. To plan the format of the survey and estimate how much time it may take.
Which of the following statements describes the reasons you must complete a water vulnerability assessment (WVA)?

Options.Option: Because a new water system has been put into place, a WVA is necessary to comply with regulatory requirements and ensure potable water quality meets drinking water standards.
Because the water system may be unable to meet demand, a WVA is necessary to determine if the system has the capability to produce and distribute an adequate supply of water.
Because the water system has been modified, a WVA is necessary to evaluate the potability of the water and ensure that it continues to remain a reliable and safe source of drinking water.
Because the water system has been modified, a WVA is necessary to identify areas in the water distribution system that could be subject to tampering, sabotage, and contamination.

Question.QuestionStem:
As you are conducting the water vulnerability assessment (WVA), which two of the following are steps you will perform in the Information Gathering phase of the WVA process?
  1. Identify Control Options
  2. Coordinate with Stakeholders
  3. Assess Security/Survivability Programs
  4. Assess Physical Assets and Access Points

Which two of the following are main points related to providing practical and effective information and recommendations?
  1. Be aware of communication that is based on risk perception, agendas, or emotions, and address those issues honestly.
  2. Compare risks that are voluntary to those not voluntary so your audience will perceive the health risk as not in their control.
  3. Use a standard form of communication between various audiences so that your message is communicated consistently each time.
  4. Build trust and honesty by providing accurate information; addressing relevant issues, options, and recommendations; and abiding by promises.

Which two of the following considerations should you follow for effective health risk communication?
  1. Prepare answers to potential questions.
  2. Use professional judgment as appropriate.
  3. Communicate by focusing on technical information.
  4. Withhold information from the public until incident has passed.

Which two of the following should be considered when performing an aircraft watering point survey?
  1. Nearby non-potable outlets
  2. Sanitation and transport procedures
  3. Critical control points (CCPs)
  4. Occupational and Environmental Exposure Limit (OEELs)

Which two of the following frequency bands will be included in an octave band survey ONLY if your equipment is capable of measuring these frequencies?
  1. 2 kHz
  2. 16 kHz
  3. 31.5 Hz
  4. 63 Hz

Which two of the following should you do before leaving the BE shop to perform an octave band survey?
  1. Recommend specific controls for the site.
  2. Perform an operation check on equipment.
  3. Pre-calibrate the sound meter equipment.
  4. Plot collected data on 85 dB(A) target spectrum.

Which two of the following are administrative controls used to control noise health threats at the receiver?
  1. Shield and Barriers
  2. Labeling Equipment
  3. Training Personnel
  4. Process Substitution
Which one of the following helps determine the point at which noise levels from a noise source become constant?
Which one of the following is NOT a BE-specific responsibility related to analyzing confined spaces?

Options.Option: Review and approve non-routine entry permits.
Assist in the interpretation of monitoring results.
Coordinate the installation confined space program.
Certify organizational personnel to test confined spaces.

Question.QuestionStem:
Which two of the following are characteristics of a non-permit required confined space?
  1. The space contains no actual or potential hazardous atmosphere.
  2. Oxygen levels in the confined space are between 19.5% and 23.5%.
  3. It contains a material that has the potential to engulf entering personnel.
  4. The space is immediately dangerous to life and health of the personnel.

Which two of the following statements are true of energy as it relates to mass?
  1. Energy (ergs) = Mass (grams) x Velocity of Light2 (m/sec)
  2. Energy (ergs) = Mass 2 (grams) x 1/2 Velocity of Light (m/sec)
  3. The total energy in a system increases as mass decreases
  4. The Theory of Relativity describes mass and energy as interchangeable

Which two of the following make up the basic factors of the electromagnetic spectrum?
  1. Frequency
  2. Wavelength
  3. Mass Defect
  4. Potential Energy
Which one of the following statements best describes radioactive decay?

Options.Option: The spontaneous emission of matter or energy from the nucleus of an unstable atom.
The spontaneous disintegration or transformation of an atom in an attempt to reach a stable state.
Occurs where there is an addition of energy to an atomic system changing the atom from a "ground" state to an excited state.
The process by which an electron is removed from the atom or molecule leaving it with a positive charge and therefore producing ion pairs.

Question.QuestionStem: Which one of the following is the process by which an electron is removed from the atom or molecule leaving it with a positive charge and therefore producing ion pairs?
Which one of the following is the most penetrating of all the types of radiation?
Which one of the following types of radiation can cause both internal and external health threats?

Which two of the following things should you instruct the x-ray technician to do when setting up the x-ray unit for a scatter survey?
  1. Set a 10" x 10" field when working with a chest x-ray.
  2. Set a 10" x 10" field when working with a table x-ray.
  3. Monitor workers and adjacent areas for radiation leakage.
  4. Obtain the maximum and normal settings for the x-ray unit.

Which two of the following situations would require an x-ray scatter survey to be conducted at a medical facility?
  1. Modifications in operation have occurred.
  2. A new x-ray unit is being installed in the facility.
  3. An x-ray technician takes a second job at night.
  4. The film is changed after a routine patient x-ray.
Which one of the following is NOT required to conduct the medical/industrial scatter survey calculation?
Which one of the following statements should you follow when determining whether to use a standard for radiation purposes?

Options.Option: Use the most readily available standard.
Use the standard accepted by the industry.
Use the most stringent standard available.

Question.QuestionStem: A scatter radiation survey in a medical facility revealed an annual exposure for radiation workers of 5,500 mR/yr, which exceeds the annual exposure limit of 5,000 mR/yr. Which one of the following is NOT an appropriate potential course of action that could address these results?

Options.Option: Increase the thickness of the shielding that is used in the x-ray room.
Implement worker rotation to reduce the time each worker is exposed.
Perform maintenance on the x-ray unit, or replace the unit if maintenance is not sufficient.
No further action is required because the exposure does not significantly exceed the limit.

Question.QuestionStem:
Which two of the following are among the groups that need to be immediately notified of a suspected ionizing radiation overexposure?
  1. Public Health
  2. AFMSA/SG3PB
  3. Security Forces
  4. MAJCOM BEE

Which two of the following are reasons ionizing radiation overexposure investigations are conducted?
  1. Create radiation protection program policy.
  2. Determine appropriate courses of action.
  3. Identity number of x-ray units in the area.
  4. Confirm an overexposure has occurred.
To which one of the following types of controls does the inverse square law apply?
Which one of the following types of materials would serve as a minimally appropriate shield for gamma and x-rays?
Once you have calculated the annual dose equivalent for the radioactive materials (RAM) storage and use survey, what should be your next course of action?

Options.Option: Sketch a diagram of the radiation storage area.
Compare the results to the appropriate standards.
Take background measurements in the survey area.
Use an ion chamber to determine dose rate exposures.

Question.QuestionStem:
Which two of the following can be assessed using a radioactive materials (RAM) storage and use survey to determine compliance with appropriate guidelines?
  1. Unsealed RAM Sources
  2. Unmarked RAM Sources
  3. Type I RAM Sources
  4. Sealed RAM Sources

When performing a radioactive materials (RAM) shipment and transport survey, if the package swipes and dose rate measurements are below applicable standards, how far away from the inner package should you perform a dose rate measurement?
Which one of the following statements best describes the purpose of surveying radioactive materials (RAM) for shipment and transport?

Options.Option: Determine the most efficient method for packing and shipping the RAM.
Log the shipment and transport history for facilities within the Air Force.
Determine the best route of transfer for RAM from one location to another.
Ensure compliance with federal regulations related to the transfer of RAM.

Question.QuestionStem: Values in which one of the following units would enable discussion of potential biological effects of radiation without concern for the radiation type?
Which one of the following is NOT an acceptable method for disposal of radioactive materials?

Which two of the following are direct effects of radio frequency radiation (RFR) exposures?
  1. Electromagnetic interference.
  2. Immune system alterations.
  3. Microwave hearing effect.
  4. Increased tissue heating.
Which of the following best describes when to use the Estimated Hazard Distance (D<sub>pel</sub>) calculation?

Options.Option: To determine a safe position from which to begin conducting a radio frequency radiation (RFR) measurement survey.
To identify what levels of annual exposure personnel surrounding the x-ray equipment may receive.
To enable discussion of the potential biological effects without consideration for radiation type.
To determine the distance where an exposure reaches an identified increase in intensity level.

Question.QuestionStem:
Which two of the following pieces of information are needed to perform the power density average (Savg) calculation to determine the level of radio frequency radiation (RFR) exposure?
  1. Intensity (I)
  2. Average Power (Pavg)
  3. Wavelength (λ)
  4. Duration of Exposure (Texp)
Which one of the following situations would prompt a radio frequency radiation (RFR) overexposure/accident investigation?

Options.Option: An x-ray technician in the MTF reports an overexposure.
Routine monitoring and assessment of RFR environments.
A new radar site is built on base near a corrosion control shop.
A worker reports walking in front of a radar emitter to their supervisor.

Question.QuestionStem: Which one of the following radio frequency radiation (RFR) controls should be used to prevent ground structures from interfering with the radar?
Which one of the following statements best describes lasers?

Options.Option: Lighting amplified by supplied energy and radiance.
Light amplification by stimulated emission of radiation.
Luminosity accelerated by simultaneous energy release.
Luminescent apparatus for stimulating energy and rays.

Question.QuestionStem: Which one of the following lasers is an example of a Class 1M laser, which is not capable of producing hazardous effects during normal operation unless viewed with an optical instrument such as a telescope?
Which one of the following describes the area within a laser workplace in which the exposure from direct beam, specular reflection, and diffuse reflection could exceed the maximum limit?
Which one of the following describes the level of laser radiation to which a person may be exposed without hazardous effects or adverse biological changes in the eyes or skin?

Which two of the following common health effects of laser hazards are associated with thermal damage?
  1. Short term tissue damage
  2. Toxic chemical reactions in tissues
  3. Energy absorption and heat build-up
  4. Photon absorption directly altering a molecule

Which one of the following steps for identifying laser hazards should you perform in the Site Identification/Sectoring phase of the Occupational and Environmental Health Site Assessment (OEHSA) process?

Options.Option: Determine which personnel may be affected by the laser hazard.
Obtain any available information about existing lasers in the area of concern (AOC).
Use measuring equipment for lasers to conduct a survey of the area.
Perform a site visit to confirm the information that has been gathered.

Question.QuestionStem: Which one of the following is NOT an appropriate control recommendation for personnel using a Class 4 laser such as precision guided munitions?
Which one of the following laser eye protection (LEP) devices would be appropriate for a laser with a wavelength of 550 nm and an optical density (OD) of 6?

Options.Option: Specifications: Wavelength of 700-1,000 nm; OD of 7+
Specifications: Wavelength of 510-680 nm; OD of 6+
Specifications: Wavelength of 430-500 nm; OD of 6+
Specifications: Wavelength of 190-380 nm; OD of 4+

Question.QuestionStem: What type of radiation can cause heat loading in the body of a worker who spends 3 hours working on an aircraft on the open flightline in the summer?

Which two of the following controls could you recommend for controlling ultraviolet (UV) radiation?
  1. Decrease time around the source.
  2. Decrease shielding around source.
  3. Increase the distance from source.
  4. Increase ventilation around source.

During which step of the biological health threat identification and analysis process will you consider what would happen to the affected population immediately and in the future as a result of controlling the health threat or choosing not to control it?
Which individual or organization is responsible for providing pest management services to control the spread of infectious disease?

Which two of the following are administrative controls that would be appropriate for biological health threats?
  1. Wearing gloves and face shields.
  2. Observing universal precautions.
  3. Using ventilation to control pressure.
  4. Training personnel on proper procedures.

Which two of the following statements are true regarding the proper maintenance of PPE for biological health threats?
  1. Most PPE used for biological health threats is disposable.
  2. BE is responsible for ensuring proper disinfection of PPE.
  3. Most PPE used for biological health threats must be bleached.
  4. PPE used for biological health threats may need to be incinerated.

Which two of the following are steps you should take while identifying chemical health threats?
  1. Disregard chemicals with countermeasures and controls in place.
  2. Conduct interviews only with supervisors to get accurate information.
  3. Consider how specific processes may introduce additional chemicals.
  4. Read Material Safety Data Sheets and consult with the HazMat Pharmacy.
Which one of the following describes the purpose of respiratory protection in the Air Force?

Options.Option: To protect personnel from inhalation hazards above identified levels of concern.
To protect personnel from absorption hazards above identified levels of concern.
To eliminate the need for more expensive controls such as ventilation systems.
To comply with standards without consideration of other countermeasures or controls.

Question.QuestionStem:
You are selecting respiratory protection for workers in the corrosion control shop. Your air sampling results indicate airborne concentrations for the contaminant of concern (COC) at 120 ppm, and the Occupational and Environmental Exposure Limit (OEEL) is 80 ppm. What is the hazard ratio for this exposure?

Hazard Ratio = Measured Concentration / OEEL

Which two of the following are true regarding selection of appropriate respiratory protection for firefighting personnel?
  1. The workers must use a full-face pressure-demand SCBA.
  2. The workers must use an air-purifying chemical cartridge respirator.
  3. The respiratory protection must meet the requirements of NFPA 1981.
  4. The respiratory protection must meet the requirements of AFOSH Std 91-25.
The Air Force Radiation Assessment Team (AFRAT) has respirators that are stored for emergency or rescue use. How often must these respirators be inspected?

Options.Option: At the end of each shift.

Question.QuestionStem:
Which two of the following conditions would require a regulated area to be established?
  1. In areas that, in the supervisor’s professional judgment, are potentially dangerous for personnel.
  2. In any occupational area where hazardous chemicals or other substances are used routinely.
  3. In areas where personal protective equipment (PPE) is required to avoid skin or eye contact hazards.
  4. In areas where the Occupational and Environmental Exposure Limit (OEEL) is exceeded and/or where threshold amounts of carcinogen use is exceeded.
Which of the following types of pressure is the difference between duct pressure and atmospheric pressure?
Which of the following is an example of an occupational setting where local exhaust ventilation is an effective measure of control?

While conducting a Health Risk Assessment (HRA) at a shop on base, you notice a ventilation system is in place; however, after performing further surveillance, you determine there is no contaminant of concern (COC) to control. Which one of the following actions is appropriate to conduct, given this situation?

Options.Option: Recommend that the ventilation system be turned off.
Perform a routine ventilation survey and compare to the baseline results.
Conduct additional air sampling to verify that no contaminants are present.

Question.QuestionStem:
Which two of the following are steps you should conduct in Phase 3, Analysis, of the toxic industrial chemical/toxic industrial material (TIC/TIM) vulnerability assessment process?
  1. Verify the data and compile the inventory.
  2. Develop worst-case and alternate scenarios.
  3. Screen toxic substances with potential to impact the base.
  4. Document and consolidate the results of the field assessment.

Select the two statements that are true regarding why and when toxic industrial chemical/toxic industrial material (TIC/TIM) vulnerability assessments are conducted.
  1. The BEE or BE Tech is required to conduct an annual assessment of local industrial facilities.
  2. The goals of the assessment are to stay abreast of current situations and assist with force health protection.
  3. A semi-annual assessment of TIC/TIM vulnerabilities on and around the base must be performed by Public Health.
  4. The assessment creates a document that tells first-responders exactly what to do if a TIC/TIM incident occurs around the base.
